text: profiles. Rec. ITU-R P.676 -13 23 7 The elevation angle at or near the surface of the Earth is the apparent rather than the free - space elevation angle. For free -space elevation angles less than or equal to 10 degrees, the apparent elevation angle can be calculated from the free -space eleva tion angle using equation (13) of Recommendation ITU -R P.834 . 8 The estimated slant path gaseous attenuation at any latitude and longitude between grid points can be estimated by bilinear interpolation of the corresponding estimates of slant path gaseous attenuation at the surrounding grid points using the procedure in Annex 1 of Recommendation ITU -R P.1144 . The slant path gaseous attenuation at each surrounding grid point should be from the height of the surface of the Earth above mean sea level at the latitude and longitude of interest to the maximum height in each profile.
